derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English næs, perhaps reinforced in Middle English by Old Norse nes; related to Old English nasu 'nose'

entry.tran: (用于形容词后构成名词)表示“状态”，“性质”
entry.def: -ness is added to adjectives to form nouns which often refer to a state or quality. For example, 'sadness' is the state of being sad and 'kindness' is the quality of being kind.

example.ex: 'This is not good,' he said with great seriousness.
example.tran: 他特别严肃地说：“这可不好。”
